documentType.label: other
reasons: Document is an insurance policy features page, not an invoice, CMR, or UB04 form.
Contains policy feature headings, bullets, and company footer (MetLife), typical of brochure or policy summary.

fields.name: document_title
fields.value: Policy Features and Benefits May Vary By State

fields.name: main_header
fields.value: FEATURES & BENEFITS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGESM AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGESM

fields.name: Home and Community Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services – Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver – Hospice Care; Adult Day Care

fields.name: Facility Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility

fields.name: Elimination Period
fields.value: 100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative

fields.name: Alternate Service Provision
fields.value: A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for OLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.

fields.name: Bed Reservation
fields.value: Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason

fields.name: Return of Premium
fields.value: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate

fields.name: International Benefit
fields.value: Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA is limited to the lesser of: (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured is in the U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added to policy: International Benefit is modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days

fields.name: Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse
fields.value: Limited coverage is provided if the insured's policy ends due to non-payment of premiums, or the insured's written request to cancel, following a substantial premium increase; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to the insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date

fields.name: Initial Needs Assessment
fields.value: 1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured; If Care Management organization is selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime

fields.name: Premium Waiver
fields.value: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits

fields.name: Coordination of Benefits
fields.value: Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare (COB and non-duplication of coverage not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider)

fields.name: additional_information_header
fields.value: ADDITIONAL INFORMATION FOR ALL POLICIES

fields.name: Payment Options
fields.value: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider – available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact the tax deductibility of the premium; The client should consult a tax advisor for further clarification

fields.name: Care Coordination Services
fields.value: MetLife Care Coordinators are available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts in the insured's area. An insured can also call for advice about caring for a loved one who needs LTC services, even if their family member is not insured with MetLife.

fields.name: Discounts
fields.value: 30% Spousal* -- 15% Marital* -- 15% Residential -- 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84) -- 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases

fields.name: Underwriting Classes
fields.value: Preferred (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84), Standard & Substandard (Always quote Standard!)

fields.name: Save Age
fields.value: Premium based on age 30 days prior to application date (underwriting requirements based on age at date of signed application)

fields.name: company_address_footer
fields.value: Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, New York, NY 10166

rows.value: Home and Community Care

Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services – Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver – Hospice Care; Adult Day Care
Facility Care
Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility
Elimination Period
100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative
Alternate Service Provision

A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for OLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.
Bed Reservation
Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason
Return of Premium
If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate
International Benefit

Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA is limited to the lesser of: (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured is in the U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added to policy: International Benefit is modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days
Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse

Limited coverage if policy ends due to non-payment or written cancellation following a substantial premium increase; provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to greater of total premiums paid or 1x MBA; total benefits paid will not exceed prior TBA
Initial Needs Assessment
1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management org selected by MetLife – no cost; If selected by insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime
Premium Waiver
Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits
Coordination of Benefits
Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare (not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider)
Payment Options

Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider – available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact tax deductibility; consult tax advisor
Care Coordination Services
MetLife Care Coordinators available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts; can provide advice about caring for loved ones even if family member is not insured
Discounts
30% Spousal*; 15% Marital*; 15% Residential; 10% Preferred Health (N/A age 80-84); 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases
Underwriting Classes
Preferred (N/A age 80-84), Standard & Substandard (Always quote Standard!)
Save Age
Premium based on age 30 days prior to application date (underwriting requirements based on age at date of signed application)
Policy Effective Dates
With Premium (Conditional Receipt may apply): Date all underwriting requirements are met; Without Premium: 28 days following underwriting approval date
